<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_is_resizable_inplace:
```c
bool
MHD_pool_is_resizable_inplace (struct MemoryPool *pool,
                               void *block,
                               size_t block_size)
{
  mhd_assert (pool->end >= pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (block != NULL || block_size == 0);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= block_size);
  if (NULL != block)
  {
    const size_t block_offset = mp_ptr_diff_ (block, pool->memory);
    mhd_assert (mp_ptr_le_ (pool->memory, block));
    mhd_assert (pool->size >= block_offset);
    mhd_assert (pool->size >= block_offset + block_size);
    return (pool->pos ==
            ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE (block_offset + block_size));
  }
  return false; /* Unallocated blocks cannot be resized in-place */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
mhd_assert (block != NULL || block_size == 0);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the assertion mhd_assert(block != NULL || block_size == 0) does not by itself create unreachable code. The condition is not a compile-time constant and (as typically implemented) the assert either checks at run-time or compiles to nothing in release builds, so it does not make any subsequent branch impossible to reach. A violation of Rule 2.1 would only occur if the macro expanded to an unconditional control transfer (for example, if mhd_assert were incorrectly defined to always return, goto, or otherwise unconditionally abort execution regardless of the condition), which would make code after the macro unreachable — but that is not the normal/expected definition of mhd_assert here.
